statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Colorado 84, Colorado Christian 65
article.story: BOULDER, Colo. -- Cory Higgins scored 15 of his 25 points in the second half, helping Colorado shut down Colorado Christian's long-shot comeback bid for an 84-65 victory Monday night. Alec Burks and Levi Knutson each added 11 points for the Buffaloes (6-3), who improved to 5-0 at home, their best start at home since winning the first five at home in 2005-06. Jobi Wall led Colorado Christian (1-5) with 18 points. Justin Neuhaus added 16 points, Anthony Urrutia had 13 and Abram Ziemer added 10 points and 12 rebounds for the Division II Cougars. Colorado led by as many as 30 points in the first half before settling for a 47-27 advantage at the break. The Cougars got within 66-56 on Rye Olson's 3-pointer with 8:15 left, but Higgins answered with a 3-pointer, then scored the Buffaloes' next seven points to put the game out of reach. Colorado Christian appeared overmatched early on, failing to score their first basket until 4:28 into the game and falling behind 28-8. Midway through the first half, the Buffaloes put together a 14-0 run. Keegan Hornbuckle, Casey Crawford and Knutson all had 3-pointers during the spree while Austin Dufault capped the burst with a three-point play.
